conclusion: Draw the forces acting on the suitcase
Weight of suitcase is mg = 15 kg × 10 m/s² = 150 N (down)
Normal reaction of the ground is N (up)
Pulling force is F = 90 N, making an angle θ above the horizontal
Horizontal component of pulling force is Fₓ = F cos θ (forward)
Vertical component of pulling force is Fᵧ = F sin θ (up)
Kinetic friction (or rolling resistance) is f = μ N (backward)
Suitcase moves at constant velocity on a horizontal floor, net horizontal and vertical forces are zero
Write the vertical equilibrium equation: N + F sin θ = mg → N = mg – F sin θ
Write the horizontal equilibrium equation: F cos θ = μ N
Express the pulling force F(θ) for a given μ: F(θ) = μ mg / (cos θ + μ sin θ)
Find the angle that gives the smallest possible pull: D_max = √(1 + μ²) and tan θ = μ
Equate the minimum pull to the given 90 N and solve for μ: μ = 0.75
Find the corresponding angle θ: tan θ = μ = 0.75, so θ ≈ 37°
Check using μ = 0.75 and θ = 37° in F(θ): F = 90 N as required
Final answers: Coefficient of friction μ = 0.75, Angle θ ≈ 37°
